strapiJob.title: Data Analyst
strapiJob.description:
Who are we: 

We are a small, but fast-growing supply chain consultancy. We are dedicated to creating long term collaborative partnerships, known as ‘upstreaming’ that remove cost from the supply chain and create shared value. Our operational expertise, ‘no win no fee’ contracts, and long-term approach differentiate us from other consulting firms – we feel a lot more like a partner to our clients than a consultancy. 

We draw from our wide-reaching flexible network to bring together the right experience and skillsets needed to succeed in each partnership; from reviewing opportunities in the supply chain, to finding the right partner, enabling clean room negotiations, contract signature, right through to ongoing management of the partnerships with governance and longer-term strategic cost reduction. 

  • We are a great place to work, with limited hierarchy and bureaucracy & huge opportunities to learn & grow. 
  • Our people are team focused and respectable with good personable soft skills (& a sense of humor!) 
  • Our people have self awareness, adaptability, and motivation to learn. 
  • We work with transparency and integrity. 
  • We care about our people and develop them – our people have the relevant skills, experience & relationships. 

What you will be doing: 

Data management and Analysis (60%) 

  • Produce business reporting and dashboards to help colleagues & client monitor, control & make decisions. 
  • Optimise reporting functionality and platforms (Power query, Retail link, Euromonitor, SQL) by working back from the business problem. 
  • Drive automation of data sources and intake processes. 
  • Building Burnsall’s infrastructure to store data in a logical and accessible way. 
  • Recommend solutions and come up with actionable insights based on the data. 
  • Be able to clearly communicate results & recommendations to colleagues and to our client.  
  • Own relationships externally and provide data support required to progress decision making. 

Research and Exploration (20%) 

  • Provide detailed research into new product categories and industries.  
  • Web-based company research to identify potential partners, determining key KPI criteria.  
  • Support build of business cases upon identification of new Upstreaming partnership. 

Continuous improvement projects with our vendor partners (20%) 

  • Analyze data from multiple sources to evaluate value adding opportunities across existing and new partnerships. 
  • Visit potential partners and identify opportunities for manufacturing efficiencies. 
  • Support colleagues & client in the analysis & delivery of continuous improvement projects.  

Skills, knowledge & experience desired: 

  • Knowledge & interest in improving retail supply chains across various consumer packed goods (CPG). 
  • At least 2 years background in BI, data analytics, consulting, e-commerce, or a related field.  
  • An understanding of the end-to-end implementation of Business Intelligence (BI) projects, especially in scorecards, KPIs, reports & dashboards. 
  • Experience with MS Excel, Power Pivot, Power BI, SQL, Retail link. Experience with VBA & Macros is a plus. 
  • Knowledge and understanding of key performance indicators related to Finance, supply chain & manufacturing. 
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills - ability to identify patterns in data and discover insights.  
  • Strong attention to detail – accuracy of reports is a hygiene factor in trust relationship. 
  • Proven ability to work with ambiguity – We are a small business that is always changing. You should be willing and able to engage & contribute to projects outside the primary scope. 
  • Accountable – proactively & independently manage expectations of our client in a timely manner. 
  • Eager to learn, curious, optimistic & humble. 

Other requirements: 

  • Able to work in the U.S.  
  • Self motivated under a remote work style  
  • Personable – strong relationship management skills internally and externally (we want to have fun!) 

What will you get: 

  • Highly flexible working environment – home based with regular in person team connects at shared office space. 
  • A highly competitive package, including 29 days holiday plus public holidays. 
  • A high trust and enjoyable working environment. 
  • Travel. 
  • A social calendar with multiple annual events.
